item.description:
Hello Atheists:

Welcome to the traditional Sunday Blasphemy Brunch! As usual, let's meet for conversation and to meet friends new and old!

One new aspect: A Fire Recovery Fundraiser! This is our same wonderful brunch, but if anyone would like to contribute to this cause please fill out the form in the Facebook link below

https://www.facebook.com/events/352304451511801/352665608142352/?notif_t=event_mall_comment

Background: 12 friends and residents of 95 Columbia Street in Cambridge became homeless on August 23rd when a fire ravaged their home and destroyed possessions (read more at http://www.boston.com/metrodesk/2012/08/23/three-alarm-fire-cambridge-leaves-homeless). The residents are all safe and have temporary places to stay, but meanwhile they lost everything -- from clothing, to pots and pans, computers, mementos, bicycles, personal collections, toiletries, suitcases, etc.

To BRING to the Brunch:

Gift cards for grocery stores, CVS, Target and restaurant gift cards and groupons, since they don't all have places to cook; and gift cards for CVS for soap, shampoo, toothbrushes, conditioner, body wash, deodorant, etc., and Target for food, clothing and housewares.

Cash contributions: Donations of $5-$20 are welcome.

I will put these items in an envelope and bring it to Molly Zen, coordinator for resources for the 12 who became homeless on August 23rd.

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Please contact Molly Zen atÂ mollyzen [at] mollyzenobia [dot] com or 818-606-2619, so that your offer of the following goods or services can be coordinated:

Legal/ Community Aid Services: If you have such knowledge- for people in need of immediate food, shelter, and how to get government support please contact the organizer.

Apartments/ Rooms for Rent: 12 people are homeless and they all need permanent housing. If you know of anyone who has a place, apartments/rooms for rent, please also contact the organizer, Molly or fill out the form on the website where she can filter though all of the support information.

To Donate Goods and Other Items: A donation location for home goods has not been set up yet, but if you have any leads on items in the following categories, please be in touch with Molly or Emilie:

  • furniture
  • beds
  • pots and pans
  • dishes, silverware
  • bedding
  • chairs
  • desks
  • computers
item.name: Blasphemy Brunch and Fire Recovery Fundraiser
